critique: This executive order focuses on preventing and controlling invasive species. It establishes definitions, assigns duties to federal agencies, creates an Invasive Species Council, and mandates a National Invasive Species Management Plan. It emphasizes coordination among agencies and stakeholders. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt. It doesn't directly address immigration, though it touches on the introduction of species. It seems to expand executive power by creating a council and assigning duties. It leans towards federal control by tasking federal agencies. It balances security and liberty by focusing on environmental protection. It involves government intervention in managing ecosystems. It promotes social inclusion by considering diverse stakeholders.
